This step involves adding a pen down action to the sprite's script, which means the sprite will start drawing when triggered. Then, a repeat loop is added around the move and turn actions, which will cause the sprite to repeatedly draw a square on the stage. Finally, the wait action is used to adjust the speed of the animation so that it moves smoothly.

Option B is incorrect because constructing the core movement pattern was done in a previous step (Event 5).
